alert.note: Alert for Pushmataha (Oklahoma) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued February 08 at 4:26PM CST until February 09 at 3:20PM CST by NWS Tulsa
info.description: ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL 11 PM CST THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...A portion of southeast Oklahoma, including the following counties, Choctaw, Latimer, Le Flore and Pushmataha. * WHEN...Until 1100 PM CST Wednesday. * IMPACTS...Flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations is imminent or occurring. Low-water crossings may be inundated with water and not passable. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 424 PM CST, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain. Flooding is ongoing or expected to occur in the warned area. Radar estimates between 2 and 4 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts up to 0.5 inches are possible in the warned area. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Hugo... Antlers... Clayton... Talihina... Boswell... Red Oak... Fort Towson... Fanshawe... Sawyer... Rattan... Soper... Albion... Snow... Cloudy... Oleta... Clayton Lake State Park... Nashoba... Stanley... Dunbar... Kosoma... - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.
